title: Schedule
text:
Guests are asked to arrive no earlier than 2pm to allow us ample setup time.
Our resident grill master will BBQ dinner and we will host an eclectic mix of live musical performances in the forest behind our garden.

title: Schedule
text:
Saturday Aug 23rd
Lazy brunch, as well as guided meditation and yoga sessions in the forest. Enjoy lounging in a hammock, plounging in the bell tent, playing board games or badminton, or getting down to some daytime DJ sets. You can also expect an intentional drum circle, a spoken word session featuring poetry and prose from some of our community‚Äôs prolific wordsmiths, and a plethora of other surprises.
Dinner will be served by one of Waterloo Region‚Äôs finest private chefs. Then it‚Äôs time to get down on the dance floor with DJs playing from early evening until after dark.

Meals

9am Brunch
6pm Dinner



Main Stage

10am Yoga with Nas
11am Mike Tudisco: Sound Healing
12pm Michael Masurkevitch: Meditation

1pm Jacob: Countering Fascism
2pm James Brown: Radical Acceptance - A Super Power
3pm Lenna: Radical Money
4pm Ali Engering: Meeting and Cultivating a Relationship With Your Inner Child

1-3pm Ciara: Reiki Sessions
4-5pm Mike McPherson: What I Learned in 10 Years of Composting



Plounge

1-3pm Sylvia Chapman: Crochet 101
4-5pm Rob Salmond: Being Human for Human Beings



Kitchen and Dining Area

2-3pm Jace J: From Beans to Brews - Exploring the Third Wave of Coffee
4-5pm: David Wellhauser: Star Trek



Film Lounge

2:30-4pm Stephanie Trotter: Learn to Drop Spindle
4-5pm Elysha: Radical Mending



Thyme Patch

2-3pm Ali Engering: Nature Mindfulness, a small taste of forest bathing.
3-4pm Micheael: Song Circle
4-5pm Ali Engering: Learn To Slackline! Zero experience required.



Main Stage

2-3pm Trash Theater: Loop There It Is

title: About
text:
Growth Festival is an independent community driven back yard celebration of interdependent evolution.
Every year we bring new gifts to the web of community we are all a part of. Growth is an invitation to celebrate our growth together, and to share the gifts of our growth with each other, whatever form they make take. Growth is also an invitation to join us at the height of our garden‚Äôs growth and to celebrate the growth of all the life this land sustains and nourishes.

title: Growth 2025
text:
When?
Augest 22nd - 24th. Check out the full schedule.

title: Growth 2025
text:
Why?
Read all about it here.

title: Growth 2025
text:
Tickets
This is an invite only event, tickets are not required. That said, a whole lot of time, energy, and money has gone into making Growth happen and donations keep this event alive. Cash donations can be made at the festival, and email money transfers can be sent to donations@growthfestival.ca.

Current total costs are approx. $200.00

To see where the money goes, all our expenses have been made public.

title: Growth 2025
text:
Photos
If you have photos of Growth 2024 or take photos this year and would like to share them, please send them to photos@growthfestival.ca.

title: Our Mission
text:
As a celebration of our ever becoming and recognizing the complexity of these times and an ever demanding world that decreases access to ‚Äòthird spaces‚Äô, growth exists to provide a space where we can engage in the creative process of exploring, evolving, and enchanting our collective consciousness. Growth is a platform for experimenting with who and what we are. Growth provides structure and framework as a starting point and context to try out what it means to embody a more creative world.
To do this well, as organizers, we adhere to the following guiding principles. These principles can be used internally but they are also the heart of the festival and undergird the collective agreements for anyone participating. Further, as a mode of accountability to each other, the earth and beyond, these values help to center and give guidance to the how of what are doing together and how to be in best relationship.

title: Our Mission
text:
As a celebration of our ever becoming and recognizing the complexity of these times and an ever demanding world that decreases access to ‚Äòthird spaces‚Äô, growth exists to provide a space where we can engage in the creative process of exploring, evolving, and enchanting our collective consciousness. Growth is a platform for experimenting with who and what we are. Growth provides structure and framework as a starting point and context to try out what it means to embody a more creative world.
To do this well, as organizers, we adhere to the following guiding principles. These principles can be used internally but they are also the heart of the festival and undergird the collective agreements for anyone participating. Further, as a mode of accountability to each other, the earth and beyond, these values help to center and give guidance to the how of what are doing together and how to be in best relationship.

title: Vision
text:
Vision

We aim to share in the growth that comes from collective expression.
This festival is a celebration of our interdependent evolution‚Äîa co-created space where we come together in our creative beingness and ever-becoming. Through music, art, skill-sharing, play, and mutual care, it is a space where we can experiment with and collectively realize the world we wish to inhabit. This is not a space for spectators, but a living, breathing participatory culture of transformation.

title: Our Values and Guiding Principles
text:
The ethos of the festival is to encourage social engagement and center relationality. As such, the following are guidelines and values we hold in our hearts and apply with our hands as we create this project:


We honor the individual and collective evolution of every participant. This space exists to nourish becoming and celebrate our shared transformations.
We are all growing together. There is no hierarchy of creativity here‚Äîno fixed roles. Everyone contributes something vital.



We are committed to creating a space that is actively anti-racist, anti-fascist, and free from homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, and ableism. As organizers we aim to address these things actively and with care.
No cops, no Nazis‚Äîwe reject oppressive systems and individuals who represent or uphold them.
Our approach to radical inclusivity acknowledges the Paradox of Tolerance‚Äîintolerance will not be tolerated.
Respect is fundamental‚Äîrespect the land, yourself, and each other in all that you do.



This is a participatory gathering, not a spectacle. Everyone contributes‚Äîthrough skills, energy, creativity, and care. Every dance floor needs a dancer, every dish needs washing. Every person has something valuable to contribute.
The festival thrives on reciprocity‚Äîa mutual exchange where everyone gives and receives. You are not here to be a bystander or to consume or for a checklist; we are here to participate, contribute, and belong.



We practice anti-capitalism and reject commodification: nothing is bought, sold, or traded‚Äîeverything is offered freely in the spirit of mutual aid, abundance, and radical generosity.
This is an anti-capitalist space‚Äîone where we practice abundance, not scarcity and we don‚Äôt have to ‚Äòproduce‚Äô or perform to the standards that capitalism demands in our every day lives. We act in the interest of each other towards mutual aid and collective benefit and wellbeing.
Giving and receiving are sacred acts.



We center abolitionist values and anti-carceral approaches to conflict‚Äîprioritizing restorative and transformative justice in organizing and in the broader community of the festival. We employ these principles when engaging in learning moments and aim towards de-escalation and seeing shared humanity.
We choose harm reduction, recognizing autonomy of individuals to make the best choices for them. As organizers we aim to provide a platform to support best care practices to those aims.
We center care, compassion, and accountability over punishment in all our interactions.
Safety is co-created, not enforced. We build a safer space through mutual responsibility. As organizers we are accountable to each other and festival goers



We are in relationship with the land, not on it. We honor the earth through reciprocity.
We are mindful of consumption and the hidden costs to earth upcycling, recycling, and using second-hand and sustainable materials first and being mindful of waste.
We acknowledge treaties and the sovereignty of Indigenous Peoples, and strive to be in right relationship with the land and its original stewards‚Äîbefore, during, and after the festival.



We celebrate individual and collective transformation‚Äîemotional, spiritual, and interpersonal growth are core to our shared experience.
This is a space for learning, unlearning, and skill sharing‚Äîa living practice of co-evolution.



While there is a schedule, we recognize that time is fluid, and flow matters. We build structure that supports, not constrains, creativity.
The program is curated with equity and freshness in mind‚Äînew voices, shared platforms, and rotating leadership.
